New Records: Spencer Horwitz hit his first career four-hit game.
Spencer Horwitz hit his second multi-homer game of his career.
Spencer Horwitz had three extra-base hits in a game for the first time in his career.
Key Match Events: Spencer Horwitz hit a Statcast-projected 420-foot homer over the center-field wall in the top of the second.
Spencer Horwitz sent a 421-foot blast into the right-field bleachers in the top of the fourth.
Spencer Horwitz hit an RBI double in the fifth, driving in Vladimir Guerrero Jr. from first.
Pre-Game Insights: Blue Jays manager John Schneider did not say whether he’ll start the left-handed-hitting Horwitz against NL Cy Young favorite (and left-hander) Chris Sale on Sunday.
Post-Match Reflections: Spencer Horwitz credited assistant hitting coach Matt Hague for helping him prepare for the game.
Spencer Horwitz said he benefits from hitting behind Vladimir Guerrero Jr. in the order.
Miscellaneous Highlights: José Berríos earned his 15th win of the season as he allowed one run on five hits over six innings.
José Berríos' 15 wins are tied for the third-most in the Majors.
Others: Spencer Schwellenbach allowed a career-worst 10 hits over five innings.
The Braves committed two errors, both of which led to runs.
